column4: anybody have any idea how to make amarok your default music player.....i tried to go system and preferred application and putting in the command line but it still opens totem..
right-click on your media file and click 'Open with other app'. Then make default
it didn't ask me to make it default..
when u right-click to open with a different app, there's a checkbox at the bottom left that says 'Make default'
i don't see that option...
bottom left of the app-chooser menu
which ubuntu?
only option i have is use a custom command..
and there is a list of applications...i select amarok..and nothing else comes up..
below that custom command should be 'Use as default for this kind of file'. In 8.04 at least :/
nope i don't see that option..
that's weird. hmmm. hang on
i wonder if it is because im opening from ntfs volume
well i copied to desktop..and still nothing..
i'm stumped. no idea why it won't show 'Use as default app' :-(
i just looked at an install of 8.04 i have on an old machine and it doesn't have the option either...
that's creepy. what desktop are u using on the 8.04?
gnome
have u tried this: http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Intrepid#Associate_default_applications
no..thanks i will review and try
i don't know i don't see any of these options under system administration...
i don't have system -> administration -> advanced or file association...
